0.title: Boy who escaped Ukraine with phone number written on hand reunites with mother
0.article_body: An 11-year-old Ukrainian boy, who travelled 1,000 km alone to reach Slovakia amid the war, has been reunited with his mother. Hassan Pisecká escaped Ukraine with only a plastic bag, passport, and telephone number scribbled on his hand. "I'd like to thank everyone from my heart. We lost everything we've had but we're healthy," his mother said.

1.title: Brazil blocks Telegram over non-compliance, CEO apologises
1.article_body: Brazilian Supreme Court has ordered the suspension of Telegram for failing to freeze accounts spreading disinformation or comply with the country's laws. Telegram CEO Pavel Durov apologized for the company's "negligence" and asked the court to delay its ruling for a few days. Apple and Google have been asked to help block their users from being able to use Telegram.

2.title: It will take years to defuse unexploded Russian mines: Ukraine
2.article_body: Ukrainian Interior Minister Denys Monastyrsky said that it'll "take years" to defuse unexploded Russian shells and mines. Ukraine will need support from the West to cope with the task once the war is over, he added. In addition to the unexploded Russian ordnances, Ukrainian forces have planted land mines at bridges, airports, and other key infrastructure to deter Russian use.

3.title: Man shot dead by neighbour during Holi celebrations in Kolkata
3.article_body: A man, identified as Dilip Chauhan, was shot dead by his neighbour during Holi celebrations following a heated argument in Kolkata, police said. The deceased was a peanut seller and accused used to work in a fish market, police added. "Around 3:00 pm we heard the sound of gunfire...We found that Chauhan had been shot," a local resident said.

4.title: Mumbai woman constable's husband shares obscene pics of her online, held
4.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested for allegedly circulating obscene pictures of his 27-year-old wife, who is a woman police constable in Mumbai, on social media, police said. A police officer at the Marine Drive police station said the accused, who lives in Pune, had a dispute with his wife, which could be the reason why he circulated the photographs online.

5.title: Police arrest 2 men for stealing scooters in Thane
5.article_body: Police have arrested two persons in Thane on Friday for allegedly stealing scooters in the city. Based on a tip-off, police laid a trap for the accused who were coming to Shastri Nagar to sell the stolen scooters at half of their price. Seven scooters stolen between 2018 and 2021 were also recovered from them.

6.title: Sunny Deol celebrates Holi on sets of 'Gadar 2', shares video
6.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol on Friday celebrated Holi with the cast and crew of his film, 'Gadar 2'. Taking to Instagram, he shared a video where he can be seen applying gulal to the film's director Anil Sharma and his son, actor Utkarsh Sharma. "#HappyHoli everyone," Sunny wrote. Utkarsh will play the role of Sunny's son in the upcoming film.

7.title: 2 drown while taking bath in Odisha river after celebrating Holi; 4 others missing
7.article_body: Two youths drowned and four others went missing while bathing in Kharasrota river in a village in Odisha's Jajpur, officials said. Seven youths had gone to the river to take a bath after celebrating Holi when they were swept away in the strong current of the river, the village sarpanch said. One of them was rescued and rushed to hospital.

8.title: Raina is a legend but was perhaps not suited for IPL 2022: RR's Sangakkara
8.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara said Suresh Raina is an "absolute legend" but was perhaps "not suited" for the upcoming IPL 2022, having gone unsold in IPL mega auction. Raina has scored 5,528 runs in 205 IPL matches so far having represented CSK and now-defunct franchise Gujarat Lions. He scored 160 runs in 12 IPL 2021 matches for CSK.

9.title: 10 MLAs sworn-in as ministers in Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's Cabinet
9.article_body: Ten MLAs were sworn-in as ministers in Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's Cabinet after they took oath on Saturday at Raj Bhavan in Chandigarh. The ceremony began with Harpal Singh Cheema, a second time MLA from Dirba, taking the oath. Aam Aadmi Party announced Kultar Singh Sandhwan, a two-time MLA from Kotkapura, as the Speaker of the 16th Punjab Vidhan Sabha.

10.title: 3 Russian cosmonauts wear colours of Ukrainian flag as they arrive on space station
10.article_body: Three Russian cosmonauts arrived at the International Space Station (ISS) wearing yellow flight suits with blue accents, colours that match the flag of Ukraine. “It became our turn to pick a colour. But, in fact, we had accumulated a lot of yellow material so we needed to use it," one of the cosmonauts said about the colour of their suits.

11.title: Will donate his body for research: Father of Indian student killed in Ukraine
11.article_body: The father of Indian student Naveen Shekarappa Gyanagoudar who was killed in the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv has decided to donate his son's body for medical research. "My son wanted to achieve something in the medical field, that didn't happen. At least his body can be used by other medical students for studies," his father added.

12.title: 8 killed, over 25 injured as private bus overturns in Karnataka
12.article_body: At least eight persons died after the private bus they were travelling in overturned in the Tumakuru district of Karnataka on Saturday. Police said that more than 25 persons sustained injuries in the accident. Initial investigations suggest that the bus, which was carrying 60 passengers, toppled after the driver lost control over the vehicle, police added.

13.title: Biden talks to China's Xi for nearly 2 hours as they discuss Ukraine war
13.article_body: US President Joe Biden talked to Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping for nearly two hours as the leaders discussed the war in Ukraine. Xi said China and US should "shoulder international responsibilities". The White House said, "President Biden described the implications and consequences if China provides material support to Russia as it conducts brutal attacks against Ukrainian cities and civilians."

14.title: Zostel could be entitled to 7% stake in IPO-bound OYO: HC bench
14.article_body: A Delhi High Court division bench has said Zostel will be entitled to 7% stake in IPO-bound OYO, if it eventually wins its claim, or be paid the value of its shareholding. As per the order, the two parties are also open to a consensual order. Zostel has been engaged in a court battle with OYO over a failed merger.

15.title: Elgar Parishad accused activist alleges tampering with COVID certificate
15.article_body: Activist Arun Ferreira, an Elgar Parishad case accused, alleged his COVID-19 vaccination certificate was tampered with and sought a probe into the same. He claimed that the certificate given to him was different from the one accessed by his family. The applicant's name, age and other details were incorrectly mentioned in the certificate provided by the prison, Ferreira's plea states.

16.title: BMC to add over 100 COVID-19 vaccination centres for 12-15 age group
16.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will increase the number of COVID-19 vaccination centres from 12 to 100-150 for children aged between 12-15 years. According to BMC, there are around four lakh children within the age group. However, there has been a low turnout in the vaccination due to the exam season, a BMC official said.

17.title: Youth beaten, booked for allegedly propagating Christianity in Karnataka
17.article_body: A youth was beaten up by right-wing activists for allegedly propagating Christianity outside a college in Hassan, Karnataka. A right-wing outfit, Bajarangi Hindu Parishat, lodged a police complaint that booked him and his wife under section 295 A of the IPC for outraging religious feelings. The outfit accused youth of luring college students to embrace the Christian faith.

18.title: Syrian Prez visits UAE, 1st trip to Arab state since war began in 2011
18.article_body: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad arrived in the UAE on Friday, his first trip to an Arab state since the Syrian war began in 2011. Assad met Abu Dhabi Crown Prince Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, who expressed willingness to strengthen ties with Syria again, Emirati state media reported. The Arab League had expelled Syria after the war broke out.

19.title: Man stabs self to death while dancing at Holika Dahan celebrations in MP
19.article_body: A man succumbed to knife injuries while celebrating Holika Dahan in the Banganga area of Madhya Pradesh, according to police. The incident took place when the man was dancing, along with other people, with a knife in his hand. The man allegedly stabbed himself, police said, adding that a case has been registered in this connection.

20.title: Man dies after falling from building while fighting over drugs in Mumbai
20.article_body: A 19-year-old man died after falling from the fourth floor of a building in Mumbai. According to police, victim Aftab Shaikh was consuming drugs with Sultan Khan on the terrace of a building in Kurla. However, both fell while fighting after Khan accused Shaikh of consuming more marijuana. The victim died on spot while Khan suffered minor injuries.

21.title: Sanjay & I are shocked beyond words: Torbaaz producer on Girish's son's death
21.article_body: Rahul Mittra, who bankrolled Girish Malik's directorial 'Torbaaz', has condoled the demise of Girish's son Mannan, who passed away after falling from the fifth floor of his building in Mumbai's Andheri on Friday. "I am non-plussed to learn about the unfortunate incident," he said. Rahul added that Sanjay Dutt is "deeply saddened too". "We are shocked beyond words," Rahul said.

22.title: Catholic body urges Guj CM to include all holy books in school curriculum
22.article_body: The Gujarat Education Board of Catholic Institutions (GEBCI) has written to Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel, requesting the state government to include the principles of all holy books in the school curriculum. This comes after the state government announced on Thursday that Bhagavad Gita will be a part of the school syllabus for classes 6-12 from the academic year 2022-23.

23.title: Glenn Maxwell marries his Indian fiancée Vini Raman, shares pic
23.article_body: Australian cricketer Glenn Maxwell got married to his Indian fiancée Vini Raman, who is a Melbourne-based pharmacist. The couple took to Instagram to share a picture from their Christian wedding ceremony, writing, "Mr and Mrs Maxwell 18.03.22." They had been dating for around four years. On March 27, the couple will get married in a traditional ceremony with Tamil-Brahmin customs.

24.title: Mithali Raj equals record for registering most 50-plus scores in Women's World Cups
24.article_body: India captain Mithali Raj has equalled the record for registering most 50-plus scores in Women's World Cups. Mithali scored 68 runs off 96 deliveries against Australia today, which is her 12th 50-plus score in Women's World Cups. She equalled the record of former New Zealand cricketer Debbie Hockley. Notably, Mithali is featuring in her sixth Women's World Cup.

25.title: Viral pic shows 'Grandson of MLA' written on number plate of man's bike in TN
25.article_body: A viral picture shows 'Grandson of Nagercoil MLA Shri MR Gandhi' written on the number plate of a man's bike in Tamil Nadu. Several social media users criticised the man, with many saying that Gandhi, who is a senior BJP leader, is unmarried. Users also said that Gandhi is a simple man who goes to the state Assembly without footwear.

26.title: NSG head constable dies by suicide in Haryana’s Manesar: Police
26.article_body: A head constable of the National Security Guard (NSG) allegedly died by suicide at the NSG camp in Haryana's Manesar on Friday, police said. The reason that led the deceased to take such an extreme step is, however, not yet certain. His wife is in a state of shock and is being treated in a hospital, police added.

27.title: India's Pooja Vastrakar smashes the biggest six of 2022 Women's World Cup so far
27.article_body: India's Pooja Vastrakar smashed the biggest six of 2022 Women's World Cup after hitting an 81-metre maximum on the bowling of Australia's Megan Schutt on Saturday. She overtook South Africa's Chloe Tryon and compatriot Smriti Mandhana, who had slammed 80-metre sixes. Vastrakar scored 34 runs off 28 deliveries against Australia.

28.title: Man killed after fight at shop near PVR Naraina in Delhi, 5 apprehended
28.article_body: Five people were apprehended for allegedly killing a man following a heated argument at a paan shop near PVR Naraina on Friday night, Delhi Police said. The victim was a 27-year-old man who was a resident of Naraina. A fight broke out after the vehicle of the deceased hit an employee of the paan shop, police added.

29.title: Kapil Sharma's fan shares his look from Nandita Das' film, he reacts
29.article_body: A fan of Kapil Sharma shared a picture of the comedian-actor on Twitter, revealing his look from Nandita Das' film. In the picture, he can be seen carrying a delivery bag on his back. "Today I saw you in person," the fan wrote. Kapil, who'll portray a food delivery rider in the film, responded, "Don't tell anyone else about it."

30.title: Kerala HC acquits ex-minister MM Mani in Anchery Baby murder case
30.article_body: Kerala High Court on Friday acquitted former Kerala Minister and CPI(M) leader MM Mani and two others accused in the Anchery Baby murder case. Anchery Baby, a Youth Congress leader, was shot dead on November 13, 1982, in Idukki. The case was reopened after Mani had said in May 2012 that three persons who had opposed the party were killed.

31.title: Google's undersea cable lands in Togo, to 'double' internet speed
31.article_body: A Google-owned subsea cable, the Equiano cable, that aims to "double" the internet speed for millions in Africa arrived in Togo on Friday. It will also make landings in Nigeria, Namibia and South Africa, with possible branches offering connections to nearby countries. It is expected to start operating by the end of the year.

32.title: 17-yr-old drowns after slipping into 25-ft pond while taking selfie in Gurugram
32.article_body: A 17-year-old boy drowned while trying to take a selfie by standing at the edge of a 25-foot-deep pond in Gurugram. Police said the boy and his two friends posed for a selfie after forming a chain by holding hands. After two of them slipped and fell, the third person jumped into water and managed to save one of them.

33.title: US military plane with 4 onboard crashes during NATO exercise
33.article_body: A US military plane with four people onboard crashed in northern Norway while taking part in the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation (NATO) drills, Norwegian officials said. Reportedly, the Marine MV-22 Osprey, belonging to the US Marine Corps, lost contact with ground support due to bad weather. Currently, there are about 3,000 US Marines in Norway for a NATO training exercise.

34.title: India reports 2,075 COVID-19 cases, 71 deaths in last 24 hours
34.article_body: India has reported 2,075 new COVID-19 cases, 3,383 recoveries, and 71 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 2,528 cases and 149 deaths. The COVID-19 death toll in the country has risen to 5,16,352, while the active caseload declined to 27,802.

35.title: 4 workers from Bengal killed, 1 missing as land caves in at Kerala construction site
35.article_body: Four workers from West Bengal died, two sustained injuries and another went missing after the land caved in at a construction site inside Electronic City in Kerala's Kochi, police said. The incident took place when they were digging land to lay pillars. Some local residents claimed that work was going on without local body's permission and without enough safety measures.

36.title: 23-yr-old who went to take bath in U'khand's Bhagirathi river goes missing
36.article_body: A 23-year-old man, who went to take bath in the Bhagirathi river with his friends after Holi celebrations on Friday in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi has gone missing. The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) team along with State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) launched a rescue operation to locate the youth, but no trace of him was found until late evening.

37.title: Drunken man attacks traffic constable with stone in Thane; arrested
37.article_body: An on-duty traffic constable was attacked with stone by drunken men at Kapurbawdi in Thane. The 56-year-old constable had levied a fine on a bike rider in a drink-and-drive case on Friday evening. His pillion rider returned after 15 minutes to take revenge from the constable and attacked him with a big stone. He has been arrested.

38.title: LG suspends all shipments to Russia amid war with Ukraine
38.article_body: South Korean multinational conglomerate LG Electronics has announced that it's suspending all shipments to Russia amid its invasion of Ukraine. LG added that it will continue to keep a close watch on the situation as it unfolds. "We are deeply concerned for the health and safety of all people, and LG remains committed to supporting humanitarian relief efforts," LG stated.

39.title: Putin's speech justifying Ukraine invasion cut midway due to technical glitch
39.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin justified the invasion of Ukraine before a packed soccer stadium on Friday. The coverage of his speech on state television was unexpectedly interrupted by what Russia said was a technical problem with a server. Soon afterwards, Putin's speech, which lasted about five minutes, was re-aired from the start.

40.title: It is b******t, it is crap: Gambhir on people thinking he doesn't like MS Dhoni
40.article_body: On being asked about people thinking he doesn't like MS Dhoni, Gautam Gambhir said, "It's b******t. It's crap." "I've so much of mutual respect for him," he added. He further said, "I hope he's never in need...but if he's ever in need in life...I'll be the first one standing next to him because of what he's done for Indian cricket."

41.title: 22-year-old man murdered by lover's family in Pune, four arrested
41.article_body: A 22-year-old man was allegedly killed by the family members of his lover in Pune. Four people have been arrested till now and the initial investigation reveals that the girl's family was against the affair between the two, police said. "Pradhunya Kamble was murdered...on Wednesday in Dangat Patil Industrial Estate," Shankar Khatke, inspector at the Warje Police Station, said.

42.title: China reports first COVID-19 deaths in more than a year
42.article_body: China's national health authorities reported two COVID-19 deaths on Saturday, the first recorded rise in the death toll since January 2021. The deaths were reported from Jilin province, which has instituted a travel ban, with people needing permission from police to travel across borders. China reported 2,157 new COVID-19 cases from community transmission on Saturday, with the majority in Jilin.

43.title: India backs ban on biological weapons at UN Security Council
43.article_body: At the UN Security Council, India backed a convention prohibiting biological weapons. "India attaches high importance to Biological and Toxin Weapons Convention as a key global and non-discriminatory disarmament Convention," India's Deputy Permanent Representative to the UN Ambassador R Ravindra said. He added it's important to ensure effective implementation of the BTWC in letter and spirit.

44.title: Tamil Nadu govt to bear cost of govt school students who get into IITs, IIMs
44.article_body: While presenting Budget 2022-23, Tamil Nadu Finance Minister P Thiaga Rajan announced the state government will bear the cost of undergraduate education of students who get into IITs, IIMs and other premier institutions. Those who studied in government schools from classes 6-12 will be eligible. Rajan proposed a monthly stipend of ₹1,000 for government school girl students pursuing higher studies.

45.title: Feeder bus service at metro stations in Pune to begin from March 21
45.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) is going to start feeder bus service at metro stations in Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad from March 21. "Initially, we have kept 20 rounds of frequency daily. Depending on the response, we will increase the frequency," PMPML Traffic Manager said. "The routes are around 8-10 kilometres as per passengers' demands," he added.

46.title: Improper handling of Taiwan issues will hit China-US ties: Xi to Biden
46.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping told US President Joe Biden on Friday, "If the Taiwan issue is not handled properly, it'll have a subversive impact on the relationship between the two countries." "Some individuals in...US are sending...wrong signals to pro-independence forces in Taiwan, and that's very dangerous," Xi told Biden on a video call. China claims Taiwan as its own territory.

47.title: Lock Upp's Sara Khan reveals ex-husband cheated on her with a spa worker
47.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant Sara Khan revealed that her ex-husband, Ali Mercchant, cheated on her with a woman who used to work at her spa in Mumbai. "I'd a spa...He was also involved in it...There was this assistant manager he appointed...I got to know about them...That's when I thought, with my workers? This is extreme...I thought that was it," she added.

48.title: Rachakonda Police arrest man for blackmailing woman with bathing video
48.article_body: The Rachakonda Police arrested a 21-year-old man for allegedly blackmailing and harassing a woman on social media. According to police, the accused, a resident of Kataram village in Bhupalpally district, is a close relative of the victim. However, he allegedly recorded a video of the victim while bathing and used it to seek sexual favours from her, police said.

49.title: 19-yr-old's body found in pond in Gurugram, friends booked for murder
49.article_body: A 19-year-old man's body was found in a pond in Gurugram's Palra village on Friday morning. Police have booked at least eight men, including the victim's friends, on charges of murder after his father's complaint. The incident took place when the victim had gone to a percolation pond for a bath with a group of friends, police said.

50.title: Biden nominates Indian-American Puneet Talwar as US envoy to Morocco
50.article_body: US President Joe Biden has nominated Indian-American Puneet Talwar to serve as Ambassador to Morocco, the White House announced on Friday. "Talwar has held senior national security and foreign policy positions in the State Department, White House, and the United States Senate," the White House said. He is currently a Senior Advisor at the US State Department.

51.title: GM buys SoftBank's stake in self-driving unit Cruise for $2.1 bn
51.article_body: General Motors has agreed to buy SoftBank Vision Fund 1's stake in its self-driving startup Cruise for $2.1 billion. It will also make a separate $1.35 billion investment in the unit that SoftBank had committed to make in 2018. The transactions will push GM's total ownership in the unit to 80%. Other remaining shareholders in Cruise include Microsoft and Honda.

52.title: Dog kennel, motor transport office inaugurated at Hyderabad CAR HQ
52.article_body: A dog kennel and a motor transport office were inaugurated at the City Armed Reserve (CAR) headquarters in Hyderabad's Amberpet on Thursday. A number of refresher courses were also organised for the personnel as part of the 15-day demobilisation camp. Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat who inaugurated the facilities lauded the services of the teams as "highly commendable".

53.title: I was struck in the head by a man, this s**t needs to stop: Actress Karen Fukuhara
53.article_body: Actress Karen Fukuhara, best known for playing Kimiko Miyashiro in 'The Boys' and Katana in 'Suicide Squad', took to Instagram to reveal that she "was struck in the head by a man". She accompanied the post with the hashtag "Stop Asian Hate". "This s**t needs to stop. Us women, Asians, the elderly need your help," she wrote.

54.title: Bangladesh win an ODI in South Africa for the first time in history
54.article_body: Bangladesh defeated South Africa by 38 runs in Centurion to register their first-ever ODI victory on South African soil. Prior to the match, Bangladesh had played 14 ODIs in South Africa, out of which they had lost 13, while one match had produced no result. Bangladesh scored 314/7 in the match, their highest-ever ODI total in South Africa.

55.title: 8-yr-old playing Holi on road dies, 3 injured after being hit by car in Mumbai
55.article_body: The driver of a private cab hit an eight-year-old boy while he was playing Holi in Mumbai's Bandra, killing him, and later hit and injured three other persons, who were on a morning walk. He was apprehended by local residents and handed over to the police. The driver reportedly told police he had mistakenly hit the accelerator, instead of brakes.

56.title: Ukrainian ballet star Artyom Datsishin dies from Russian shelling injuries
56.article_body: Ukrainian ballet star Artyom Datsishin passed away on Thursday from wounds he suffered in Russian shelling weeks earlier. Datsishin was a principal dancer with the National Opera of Ukraine. Earlier, Ukrainian actress Oksana Shvets was killed in a Russian rocket attack on a residential building in Kyiv.

57.title: 13-year-old boy killed, 4 injured after car hits autorickshaw in Delhi
57.article_body: A 13-year-old boy was killed and four others were injured after a car hit an autorickshaw on the Barapullah flyover in Delhi on Friday, police said. The autorickshaw driver and four members of a family were injured in the accident, police added. One of the injured family members was declared brought dead to the AIIMS Trauma Centre.

58.title: Indian firms may replace Western pharma companies leaving Russian market: Russia
58.article_body: Indian firms may replace Western pharmaceutical companies leaving the Russian market over Ukraine war, Russian envoy to India Denis Alipov told the Rossiya 24 broadcaster. The newly appointed Russian envoy added that India is a "world pharmacy". Earlier this month, Alipov had said that Moscow welcomed the independent foreign policy of India amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

59.title: Fortunes of US oil tycoons jump 10% to $239 billion amid Russia-Ukraine war
59.article_body: The collective net worth of American oil and gas industrialists jumped nearly 10% to $239 billion since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. Harold Hamm, the Co-founder of Continental Resources, moved up 28 places on Bloomberg's list of world's 500 richest people with $18.6 billion fortune. Meanwhile, Freeport LNG's Founder Michael Smith entered the list for the very first time.

60.title: Biden, Xi discuss Russia-Ukraine conflict in 2-hour-long video call
60.article_body: US President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday discussed the Russia-Ukraine conflict for nearly two hours on a video call. Xi told Biden that conflicts and confrontations were in no-one's interests, according to a Chinese foreign ministry statement. The US has sought to deter China from providing military or economic assistance for Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

61.title: LeT module busted in J&K’s Pulwama, 6 alleged militants arrested
61.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir police on Friday arrested six alleged militants after busting a module of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) in Pulwama district. "Preliminary probe revealed they were involved in providing logistics, shelter and motivating youth to act as hybrid terrorists," police said. The investigating team also learnt they were working for Reyaz Ahmad Dar alias Sheeraz of LeT, a spokesman said.

62.title: Partially eaten body of missing man found in jungles of UP's Kanpur
62.article_body: A 32-year-old labourer who went missing after leaving home for work on Wednesday has been found dead in jungles of Nirala Nagar railway ground in UP's Kanpur, with his body partially eaten by animals. The police also recovered a blood-stained brick along with a pair of slippers and handkerchief from near the body. His body has been sent for post-mortem.

63.title: Russia & Canada argue on Twitter over 'kindergarten-level' UN letter edits
63.article_body: A Russian envoy engaged in an argument with the Canadian mission to the United Nations, after the latter made several changes to a letter sent by Russia on providing aid access and civilian protection in Ukraine amid the war. Reacting to it, the Russian envoy said, "Thank you...for this kindergarten-level Russophobic libel!...It...shows that your...good manners are at lowest ebb."

64.title: 900 trees likely to be cut to widen 5 km road in MP's Indore
64.article_body: Around 900 trees have been identified for felling to facilitate the widening of a 5 km stretch on road in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, civic official Chetan Patil said, adding that only 10% of the trees would be transplanted. Trees such as neem and peepal would be uprooted by machines and transplanted using a special technique, he further said.

65.title: Presence of anthrax found in dead deer at IIT Madras campus
65.article_body: At least four deer deaths were recorded in IIT Madras campus in the last two days with testing "revealing the presence of anthrax" in one case, the institute said. According to National Health Portal, anthrax is an infectious zoonotic disease, meaning it can spread from animals to humans. Wildlife personnel who handled carcass will be administered antibiotics, the institute added.

66.title: High energy costs amid Ukraine conflict trigger protests in Europe
66.article_body: High energy costs due to Russia-Ukraine conflict have led to protests by farmers in France and Greece, while truckers in Spain have gone on strike. Notably, a substantial part of the oil and natural gas supply to Europe comes from Russia. Reportedly, the war worsened an energy supply crunch that has driven up costs for households and businesses for months.

67.title: Federer to donate $500,000 to support Ukrainian children’s education
67.article_body: Roger Federer on Friday said he will donate $500,000 through his foundation "to establish access to continued schooling for Ukrainian children" affected by Russia's invasion. "My family and I are horrified seeing pictures from Ukraine and heartbroken for the innocent people who have been so terribly affected. We stand for peace," he said. Federer is a 20-time Grand Slam champion.

68.title: Russian, Belarusian athletes banned from Diamond League
68.article_body: Premier track and field competition Diamond League has excluded Russian Authorised Neutral Athletes (ANA) and Belarusian athletes from its events "for the foreseeable future", organisers said. The decision has been taken following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "The Wanda Diamond League meetings accepted the recommendation of the board to exclude the respective athletes," organisers said.

69.title: He’s my idol since I was a kid: 18-year-old Alcaraz on Rafael Nadal
69.article_body: World number 19 Carlos Alcaraz on Saturday will play against his idol Rafael Nadal in the semi-finals of the BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells. The 18-year-old beat defending champion Cameron Norrie 6-4, 6-3 to reach the semi-finals. "It's amazing to play against Rafa," Alcaraz said. "I think it's going to be a great match," he added.

70.title: Practised against tape-ball: Rizwan on preparations before Karachi Test
70.article_body: Muhammad Rizwan, who scored 104* in fourth innings of drawn second Pakistan-Australia Test, revealed how he prepared with "different drills" before Karachi Test. "I asked Iftikhar Ahmed in...nets to use tape-ball and bowl from angles like Pat Cummins did. Then...asked Zahid Mahmood [leg-spinner] to bowl to me in...rough area around...crease where we'd made marks from our spikes," he added.

71.title: BJP fields Agnimitra Paul against Shatrughan Sinha for Asansol by-poll
71.article_body: The BJP has fielded fashion designer-turned-politician Agnimitra Paul against TMC candidate Shatrughan Sinha for the Lok Sabha by-election from Asansol constituency. Similarly, the party has fielded Keya Ghosh against ex-Union Minister Babul Supriyo, who has been given a ticket by the TMC, for the by-election from Ballygunge seat. The by-polls for the two seats will be held on April 12.

72.title: Decision to quit BJP prompted by politics of hatred: Babul Supriyo
72.article_body: TMC leader Babul Supriyo, who quit BJP last year, said the decision was prompted by politics of "hatred and divisiveness" practised by its members. He further said he couldn't accept BJP leadership's "refusal to acknowledge...good work of a Bengali". BJP national secretary Anupam Hazra responded saying it's "ironical he didn't discover these traits and vices" when he was a minister.

73.title: Stop spreading threats against Russians on YouTube: Russia tells Google
73.article_body: Russian media regulator Roskomnadzor on Friday urged Google to stop spreading "anti-Russian" content on YouTube. "The actions of YouTube's administration are of a terrorist nature and threaten the life and health of Russian citizens," it said. Earlier this week, Russia blocked Instagram after its parent firm Meta allowed Ukrainian users to post messages such as "Death to the Russian invaders".

74.title: Google Maps down for several users globally, reason unknown
74.article_body: Google Maps went down for several users globally. According to Down Detector, the issues with the service started at around 9.15 pm IST. Several users complained their maps aren't loading, while others said they're getting a message reading 'Map's can't reach the internet'. In India, several users from Delhi, Ahmedabad, Kolkata, Mumbai and Hyderabad reported issues, as per Down Detector.

75.title: German parliament approves new law to lift most COVID-19 restrictions
75.article_body: Germany's parliament, known as the Bundestag, on Friday approved a new law in a 388-277 vote that lifted most COVID-19 restrictions. Health Minister Karl Lauterbach said the new Infection Protection Act was a "difficult compromise". Germany's Robert Koch Institute on Friday reported 2,97,841 new COVID-19 cases. Wearing of masks is no longer required in schools, shops or restaurants.

76.title: We're not here to prove anything: Hardik on GT's approach ahead of IPL
76.article_body: Talking about Gujarat Titans' approach ahead of upcoming IPL 2022, skipper Hardik Pandya said they are not in the tournament to "prove anything". He added, "We're here to make sure that the environment is right for...players to flourish in their own capacity." New franchise GT will begin their IPL campaign against fellow tournament debutants Lucknow Super Giants on March 28.

77.title: COVID-19 pandemic is far from over: WHO
77.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has stated that COVID-19 pandemic is far from over. "We are definitely in the middle of the coronavirus pandemic," WHO spokesperson Dr Margaret Harris said. After more than a month of decline, COVID-19 cases have started to increase around the world last week, the WHO said.

78.title: Russian oligarch's superyacht stuck in Norway as no one is selling it fuel
78.article_body: A superyacht owned by a Russian oligarch is stuck in a Norwegian port because no one is willing to sell it fuel in protest of the Ukraine war. The Ragnar is valued at $85 million and is owned by Vladimir Strzhalkovsky. Meanwhile, the yacht’s captain said that none of the crew is Russian and that such discrimination is "extremely unjust".

79.title: Over 18,000 Ukrainians granted EU citizenship in 2020: Eurostat
79.article_body: The European Union's (EU) statistics office Eurostat on Friday said around 18,100 Ukrainians were granted citizenship of EU countries in 2020, mainly by Poland and Germany. Eurostat data showed over 7,29,000 foreign nationals were granted citizenship by the EU's 27 member states. Ukrainians made up 3% of new citizens in 2020. Poland naturalised about 3,900 Ukrainians, most in the EU.

80.title: Man rapes Dutch woman in Jaipur after she calls him for Ayurvedic body massage
80.article_body: A man raped a 31-year-old Dutch woman after she called him for Ayurvedic body massage at a hotel in Jaipur. Police have arrested the accused named Biju Murlidharan, who was living in a rented accommodation in the Khatipura area of the city. "A medical examination of the woman has also been done and the accused is being interrogated," police said.

81.title: I've heard there's no coach like him: DC's Mandeep on head coach Ponting
81.article_body: Praising Ricky Ponting, DC batter Mandeep Singh said he's keenly looking forward to working with head coach of the franchise, adding he's heard people say that there's no coach like him. "He's one of the legends of the game...he's someone who maintains a healthy team atmosphere," he added. Mandeep was bought by DC for ₹1.1 crore in 2022 mega auction.

82.title: 1 BSF jawan dead, another missing as vehicle falls into water in Assam
82.article_body: One BSF personnel died after the vehicle he was travelling in with four others plunged into a water body in Assam's South Salmara Mankachar district along the Indo-Bangladesh border. Three personnel were rescued, however, a search operation is underway for the driver, who is missing. "It's suspected that the driver of the vehicle had lost control," a senior officer said.

83.title: I would love to see the now version of 'Friends': Lisa Kudrow
83.article_body: Actress Lisa Kudrow, who portrayed Phoebe Buffay on 'Friends', has said that she'd love to see a reboot of the series with an all-new cast and what the "now version" of it would be. Lisa and Jennifer Aniston, David Schwimmer, Matt Leblanc, Courteney Cox and Matthew Perry had earlier come together for a reunion episode which aired in May 2021.

84.title: Lakshya Sen, Gayatri Gopichand-Treesa Jolly enter All England semis
84.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist Lakshya Sen entered men's singles semi-finals of All England Championships after his opponent Lu Guang Zu of China gave a walkover on Friday. Ex-champion Pullela Gopichand's daughter Gayatri along with her partner Treesa Jolly saved two match points to reach women's doubles semi-finals after beating second seeds Lee Sohee and Shin Seungchan 14-21, 22-20, 21-15.

85.title: What are the 'Kamikaze' Switchblade drones that US is sending to Ukraine?
85.article_body: The 'Kamikaze drones' or the Switchblade drones are equipped with cameras, guidance systems and explosives, and can be carried in a backpack. The 'Kamikaze drones' are capable of circling above a target until the moment they can strike it with precision. The 'Kamikaze' attacks were a Japanese suicide bombing tactic deployed to attack enemy warships during World War II.

86.title: Food supply chains falling apart in Ukraine: World Food Programme
86.article_body: Food supply chains in Ukraine are "falling apart" due to the conflict with Russia, a World Food Programme (WFP) official said. "Movements of goods have slowed down due to insecurity and...reluctance of drivers," the official added. Key infrastructure such as bridges and trains have been destroyed by bombs and many grocery stores and warehouses are empty, according to Reuters.

87.title: I don't know how to live: Russian oligarch after being sanctioned by EU, UK
87.article_body: A Russian oligarch revealed that he doesn’t know how to live, days after he was sanctioned by the European Union and the UK. Mikhail Fridman, whose net worth was $14 billion before the war, is now worth around $10 billion. Fridman, a co-founder of the London investment firm LetterOne, added, "I don't understand the logic behind punishing me."

88.title: Best way to get a seat at the table is to pull up a chair: Indra Nooyi
88.article_body: PepsiCo's former CEO Indra Nooyi said the best way to get a seat at the table is to pull up a chair. In a video posted on LinkedIn, she added, "Don't wait to be invited because the invitation may never come. Actively seek out opportunities to participate and take every opportunity you can to share your talent and unique perspective."

89.title: Director Girish Malik's 17-year-old son passes away after falling from 5th floor
89.article_body: Director-producer Girish Malik's 17-year-old son Mannan passed away after falling from the fifth floor of his building in Mumbai's Andheri on Friday. Mannan was rushed to Kokilaben Ambani Hospital but he did not survive, ETimes reported. The incident happened after 5 pm when he returned to his home after celebrating Holi.

90.title: Which countries are seeing a spike in COVID-19 cases?
90.article_body: Several countries have reported a spike in COVID-19 cases in last few days. South Korea reported record more than 6,21,000 infections on Thursday. Italy reported 79,895 coronavirus cases on Thursday. In UK, the number of COVID-19 patients in hospital increased from 8,210 on March 3 to 11,346 on March 17. Germany reported 294,931 new cases in the past 24 hours.

91.title: Hundreds still trapped under theatre bombed by Russia: Ukraine
91.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that rescue work was ongoing to save hundreds of people still believed to be trapped under the rubble of a bombed theatre in Mariupol city. "There is only this information: 130 people are alive and have been taken out. The rest are waiting for help," an official said. The theatre was bombed by Russia.

92.title: No explanation: Smriti on India's inconsistent batting in Women's WC
92.article_body: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana said there's "no explanation" for the team's inconsistent batting performances in ongoing 2022 Women's World Cup. "Well, if I had an explanation, I would've definitely discussed [it] in...team dressing room," she added. Smriti further said the team's batting unit together hasn't clicked in the tournament so far. India are currently fourth in standings.

93.title: Team helped me stand on my feet again after I lost my father: Vandana
93.article_body: Speaking about a major turning point in her life after her father passed away in April 2021, Indian women's hockey team forward Vandana Katariya said, "The support I received from my teammates...(head coach) Janneke Schopman helped me stand on my feet again." Notably, Vandana became the first Indian woman hockey player ever to score a hat-trick at Olympics in Tokyo.

94.title: Not interested right now: Daniel on reprising Harry Potter role
94.article_body: Actor Daniel Radcliffe has stated that he's not really interested in reprising his role of Harry Potter right now. Chris Columbus had said he wants to cast the original trio in the film adaptation of 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child'. "I feel like I made it out of Potter okay and I'm...happy with where I am now," Daniel added.

95.title: West Indies' Shamilia collapses on field during Women's World Cup match
95.article_body: West Indies pacer Shamilia Connell collapsed on the field during 47th over of Bangladesh's innings in a Women's World Cup match. The medical staff attended to her before taking her off the ground. She was then taken to a hospital in an ambulance. "She's a strong girl and we're backing her to get well soon," her teammate Hayley Matthews said.

96.title: NZ couple's Guinness World Record application for 'world's largest potato' rejected
96.article_body: Guinness World Records has rejected an application by a New Zealand couple, who believed they had dug up the world's largest potato weighing 7.9 kg. "Sadly the specimen is not a potato and is in fact the tuber of a type of gourd," Guinness World Records told the couple in an email following months of submitting photos and paperwork.

97.title: Pic shows 109 empty prams in Ukrainian city to honour children killed in ongoing war
97.article_body: As many as 109 empty prams were placed on the Rynok Square in Ukraine's Lviv in honour of children killed in the war against Russia. "Thatʼs the number of Ukrainian children mercilessly killed by Russian troops since the beginning of the full-scale war," Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs tweeted while sharing a picture.

98.title: OTT allows artistes, storytellers to explore global stories: Madhuri
98.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit in an interview has stated that OTT platforms allow artistes and storytellers to explore global stories. "In the medium of OTT, you can be a first-time director but you can show a story in your own language or shoot it the way you want to," the actress added. Madhuri further said that OTT offers flexibility with subjects.

99.title: Adani Group exploring buying a stake in oil giant Saudi Aramco: Report
99.article_body: Adani Group is exploring the possibility of buying a stake in oil gaint Saudi Aramco, Bloomberg reported. Billionaire Gautam Adani-led conglomerate has held preliminary talks on a range of potential cooperation and joint investment opportunities with Aramco and Public Investment Fund (PIF), the report said. Adani may offer PIF the opportunity to invest in infrastructure in India, it added.

100.title: Govt land worth ₹150 cr freed from encroachers in Madhya Pradesh
100.article_body: More than 100 hectares of government land worth over ₹150 crore were freed from encroachers in Madhya Pradesh's Orchha, the Niwari district Collector said. An order has been issued retaking possession of these land parcels, which were usurped using fraudulent means, he added. This includes land given to tribals on lease by the government free of cost, he further said.

101.title: Dhoni's wicket best moment in IPL 2021, want to dismiss Kohli now: Sakariya
101.article_body: DC pacer Chetan Sakariya has said picking CSK captain MS Dhoni's wicket was the best moment for him from IPL 2021. "Virat [Kohli] bhai is...one batsman I'd like to dismiss in IPL 2022," he added. Sakariya, who played his debut season of IPL for RR in 2021, was bought by DC for ₹4.2 crore at IPL mega auction last month.

102.title: Tokyo Olympics gold has motivated me to do even better: Neeraj Chopra
102.article_body: Neeraj Chopra said the javelin gold medal he won at Tokyo Olympics has motivated him to do "even better" in life. He added he wants to win his first-ever World Championships medal and defend his Commonwealth Games and Asian Games gold medals this year. He's been nominated in 2022 Laureus World Sports Awards in 'World Breakthrough of the Year' category.

103.title: Dalai Lama makes 1st public appearance after more than 2 years
103.article_body: Dalai Lama on Friday made his first public appearance in over two years after his offline engagements were cancelled due to COVID-19. While addressing a gathering in Dharamshala, Dalai Lama said he's in "good health and can even play boxing with the doctor". "This is a very beautiful day and we're getting to see his Holiness," an audience member said.

104.title: Everton’s Iwobi scores 99th minute winner to beat Newcastle 1-0 in PL
104.article_body: Everton's Alex Iwobi on Thursday scored in the ninth minute of stoppage time to help Everton beat Newcastle United 1-0 in the Premier League. The match was delayed at the start of the second-half after a pitch invader tied himself to a goalpost. The win helped Everton move three points above the relegation zone in 17th place with 25 points.

105.title: West Ham beat Sevilla 2-0, Barcelona beat Galatasaray 2-1 in Europa League
105.article_body: West Ham United on Thursday beat Sevilla 2-0, while Barcelona beat Galatasaray 2-1 in their respective Europa League last-16 second-leg ties to reach the quarter-finals. Ukrainian international Andriy Yarmolenko scored in extra-time to win the game for West Ham. Goals by Pedri and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang helped Barcelona win 2-1 after the Turkish side took the lead in the 28th minute.

106.title: Body of 21-yr-old Indian student killed in Ukraine to reach Bengaluru on Mar 20
106.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said the mortal remains of Indian student Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, who was killed during shelling in Ukraine on March 1, will arrive in Bengaluru on March 20. The 21-year-old student, a resident of Karnataka's Haveri district, was standing in a  queue at a supermarket in Kharkiv when he was killed in the shelling.

107.title: Perverse abuse of power: Pope Francis on Russia’s invasion of Ukraine
107.article_body: Pope Francis on Friday condemned Russia's invasion of Ukraine, calling it a "perverse abuse of power". Russia began its invasion of neighbouring Ukraine on February 24. "Once more humanity is threatened by a perverse abuse of power and partisan interests which condemns defenceless people to suffer every form of brutal violence," he said.

108.title: Red Bulls’ Perez calls for drivers to be allowed to race with COVID-19
108.article_body: Red Bull's Sergio Perez believes Formula One drivers should be allowed to race if they test positive for COVID-19. "There's so much we've learned about the virus that going forward we should discuss whether we allow the drivers to race if the symptoms are mild," he said. Aston Martin's Sebastian Vettel will miss the Bahrain Grand Prix after testing positive.

109.title: How has India ranked in World Happiness Report over the years?
109.article_body: In the 2022 World Happiness Report, India ranked 136th among 146 countries, while in 2021, it had ranked 139th among 149 countries. In 2020, India's rank was 144th, while in 2019, India was ranked 140th. In the 2018 report, it ranked 133rd and in 2017, it ranked 122nd. India was ranked 118th out of 157 countries in the 2016 report.

110.title: 'Spider-Man', 'WandaVision' win at Critics Choice Super Awards 2022
110.article_body: Marvel's 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' and 'WandaVision' were awarded Best Superhero Movie and Best Superhero Series respectively at the Critics Choice Super Awards 2022. Actor Andrew Garfield won Best Actor in a Superhero Movie for his role in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'. Actress Florence Pugh was awarded Best Actress in a Superhero Movie for 'Black Widow'.

111.title: I'm still the girl who started 10 yrs ago, haven't mastered everything: Alia
111.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said that she is still the young girl who started in the film industry 10 years ago, adding she doesn't think she has mastered everything. The actress added that she will continue to learn and grow only if she doubts herself. "Being grounded is all about not believing in one's own success or failure," Alia said.

112.title: Lia Thomas becomes first transgender woman to win NCAA swimming title
112.article_body: Lia Thomas on Thursday became the first transgender woman to win an NCAA swimming title after winning the women's 500-yard freestyle. The University of Pennsylvania swimmer won with a time of four minutes and 33.24 seconds. Thomas competed on the men's team for three years before moving to the women's team. "It means the world to be here," Thomas said.

113.title: Russian soldiers shooting themselves in the legs to avoid fighting: Reports
113.article_body: Some Russian soldiers have been shooting themselves in the legs using Ukrainian ammunition to appear as if they were hit by the defenders and escape fighting. In a leaked audio clip between soldiers, one Russian said, "They’ve been shooting at us for 14 days. We’re scared. We’re stealing food, breaking into houses. We’re killing civilians."

114.title: Lives being sacrificed for senseless war: Arnold on Russia-Ukraine war
114.article_body: Actor-politician Arnold Schwarzenegger shared a video for Russian soldiers amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, saying, "Your lives, your limbs and your futures are being sacrificed for a senseless war condemned by the entire world." Arnold further said Russian government lied to its citizens and soldiers. "Russia, because of its brutality, is now isolated from the society of nations," he said.

115.title: Very important: Mandhana ahead of India vs Australia in Women's WC
115.article_body: Opener Smriti Mandhana, who is India's top-scorer in 2022 Women's World Cup so far, said match against Australia on Saturday is "very important", adding she hopes to contribute in it. "Everyone knows what happened in 2017 but...it's going to be a fresh day [tomorrow]," she added. Five years ago, India beat Australia by 36 runs to enter World Cup final.

116.title: PMC committees to operate under Administrator's leadership: Official
116.article_body: Various committees of the Pune Municipal Corporation will continue to function under the leadership of the Administrator after the five-year term of PMC's elected body ended on March 14, the Municipal Secretary said. PMC Commissioner Vikram Kumar was appointed as the Administrator of the civic body. Kumar will decide on proposals submitted to the committees, the Secretary added.

117.title: Cyclist dies after boy aims water filled balloon at scooter in Maha
117.article_body: A 54-year-old cyclist died in the Virar area of Maharashtra's Palghar district after being hit by a scooter whose driver lost control as a result of being hit by a water-filled balloon. The balloon was allegedly thrown by a boy travelling on a truck. The deceased, Ramchandra Patel, died on the spot, police said, adding, a probe is underway.

118.title: Priyanka Chopra sells her Rolls-Royce Ghost to a Bengaluru-based businessman
118.article_body: Priyanka Chopra has sold her Rolls-Royce Ghost she had bought in 2013 to a Bengaluru-based businessman. While the price at which the actress sold her car isn't known yet, the base price of the car when she bought was ₹4.5 crore. Priyanka reportedly sold the car as it was not being used frequently with her having shifted base to US.

119.title: 3 injured after tempo and car collide on Mumbai's Hindmata bridge
119.article_body: Three people were injured following a collision between a tempo and a car at Mumbai's Hindmata bridge on Friday morning. No casualties were reported in the incident and the injured have been admitted to KEM Hospital. According to reports, the incident led to a huge traffic jam with queues on the bridge for about 2 kilometres.

120.title: Catholic cross vandalised at Mumbai's Vile Parle
120.article_body: Representatives of the Catholic East Indian community in Mumbai have made a representation to the police and CM after a catholic cross in Vile Parle was allegedly vandalised last week. The representation stated that a "definitive pattern" is seen in such incidents, adding, they are done with "deliberate intentions of hurting the religious sentiments of the Christian Community".

121.title: Pic shows word 'children' written around Ukrainian theatre before powerful bomb hit it
121.article_body: A satellite image has surfaced online showing a closer view of the Mariupol Drama Theatre before it was hit by a powerful bomb. In the picture, word "children" in Russian can be seen written in large white letters around the theatre. Around 1,000 and 1,200 people had sought refuge in the building, as per Mariupol's Deputy Mayor Sergei Orlov.

122.title: I personally chased BYJU'S CEO for our 1st meeting in 2016: Unacademy CEO
122.article_body: Unacademy's Co-founder and CEO Gaurav Munjal revealed that he personally chased Byju Raveendran, the Co-founder and CEO of rival edtech startup BYJU'S, for their first meeting in 2016 when Munjal was "a young edtech entrepreneur". Munjal told Moneycontrol, "The reference I've always made is that I want Unacademy to beat BYJU'S and become the no. 1 edtech company in India."

123.title: Jaya Bachchan gets angry at photographers, video surfaces
123.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing veteran actress Jaya Bachchan getting angry at photographers clicking her pictures. In the video, Jaya can be seen sitting inside a car and talking to someone. As paparazzi came near her car, she looked at them in anger and made a hand gesture. "Why does she give such reaction every time," a user commented.

124.title: Quess Corp Founder donates ₹105 cr to IISc to set up centre for public health
124.article_body: Quess Corp Founder Ajit Isaac and his wife Sarah have committed ₹105 crore to establish a Centre for Public Health at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru. The centre will be a part of the postgraduate medical school and it will be operational by 2024. Earlier, Mindtree Co-founders donated ₹425 crore to IISc to establish the medical school.

125.title: Which are the bottom 10 countries on the World Happiness Report?
125.article_body: The United Nations’ World Happiness Report has ranked Finland to be the world’s happiest country in the world, for the fifth consecutive year while Afghanistan was named as the unhappiest country. The 10 countries at the bottom of the list included Zambia at 137th rank, followed by Malawi, Tanzania, Sierra Leone, Lesotho, Botswana, Rwanda, Zimbabwe, Lebanon and Afghanistan.

126.title: I played Akshay's mother in 'Waqt' because I wanted to: Shefali Shah
126.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has said that she played Akshay Kumar's mother and Amitabh Bachchan's wife in 2005 film 'Waqt: The Race Against Time' because she wanted to. She added that husband Vipul Amrutlal Shah didn't want her to do it but it was her choice. Shefali is five years younger than Akshay and was 28 when she did the film.

127.title: German Chancellor Scholz defends removing most COVID-19 restrictions
127.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Thursday defended his government's plan to remove almost all COVID-19 restrictions in the country on March 20. "We are entering a new phase of the pandemic, in which we, like nearly all our neighbouring countries, will be getting rid of nearly all protective measures," he said. Masks will be required on public transportation and hospitals.

128.title: Assam startup names tea blend after Ukrainian Prez to honour his courage
128.article_body: An Assam-based startup has launched a new brew of a "strong Assam tea" named after Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to "honour his valour and courage" amid the Russian invasion. Aromatic Tea's Director Ranjit Baruah, said, "There’s nothing stronger than him at the moment in the world...I was trying to draw an analogy that this tea is as strong as Zelenskyy."

129.title: Nuis becomes 1st speed skater in history to clock 100 kmph, video goes viral
129.article_body: Dutch speed skater Kjeld Nuis broke the world record by clocking 103 kmph over natural ice on Norway’s Savalen Lake. The 32-year-old three-time Olympic champion exceeded the 100 kmph mark as he added a further 10 kmph to his existing speed record. He said, "I was literally flying over the ice...This is really the maximum that is possible on skates."

130.title: 'The Kashmir Files' earns over ₹100 crore worldwide in 7 days
130.article_body: Vivek Agnihotri-directorial 'The Kashmir Files' has surpassed ₹100-crore earnings worldwide in seven days of the film's release. Actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram to reveal that the film has earned ₹106.80 crore in seven days, writing, "Our film 'The Kashmir Files' is showing its true colours! Happy Holi to all!"

131.title: Big B shares pic with Jaya on Holi, granddaughter Navya photobombs
131.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan on Thursday took to Instagram to share a picture with his wife actress-politician Jaya Bachchan celebrating Holi. The actor can be seen applying tika to Jaya on her forehead and a glimpse of their granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda can be seen in the background. Their daughter Shweta Bachchan commented on the photo, "How cute. Happy Holi."

132.title: Bhagavad Gita is for all, not only for Hindus: Karnataka Edu Min
132.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh has said that the holy book of Bhagavad Gita "is not only for Hindus, but for all". His statement comes after the Gujarat government has decided to introduce the Bhagavad Gita in the school syllabus for classes 6-12. He further said that "if experts say, it will definitely be introduced" in Karnataka as well.

133.title: He's irritable & forgetful: Russia as Biden calls Putin 'murderous dictator'
133.article_body: Russia said US President Joe Biden's comments about President Vladimir Putin are "personal insults". Biden had called Putin a "war criminal" and a "murderous dictator". "Given such irritability from Biden, his fatigue and sometimes forgetfulness...fatigue that leads to aggressive statements, we'll not make harsh assessments so as not to cause more aggression," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said.

134.title: I can make a film with Shah Rukh Khan in my sleep: Farah Khan
134.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan has said that she can make a film with actor Shah Rukh Khan in her sleep. She added that when the timing is right, it will fall into place. Shah Rukh has worked in Farah's 'Main Hoon Na', 'Om Shanti Om' and 'Happy New Year'. She further said that her films should get mass acclaim.

135.title: Poland to propose peacekeeping mission for Ukraine at NATO summit: PM
135.article_body: Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki on Friday said that Poland will formally submit a proposal for a peacekeeping mission in Ukraine at the next NATO summit. Notably, Morawiecki and the Prime Ministers of Slovenia and the Czech Republic had recently visited the Ukrainian capital Kyiv despite the ongoing war. Several NATO nations have provided military aid to Ukraine amid the conflict.

136.title: Don't politicise legitimate energy transactions: Govt sources
136.article_body: India's legitimate energy transactions should not be politicised and countries that are either self-sufficient in oil or are importing from Russia cannot credibly advocate restrictive trading, government sources said. The remarks come amid reports of India purchasing discounted crude oil from Russia, which is facing international sanctions over its invasion of Ukraine.

137.title: I call him Pammi aunty: Pooja Hegde on 'Cirkus' co-star Ranveer Singh
137.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde opened up about sharing screen space with Ranveer Singh in the upcoming comedy film 'Cirkus' and said, "He is like full entertainment." "I call him Pammi aunty. He's just too much fun to be around, and he's so observant of everybody," she added. "We make a great onscreen pair also," Pooja further said.

138.title: World C'ships silver-medallist Kidambi loses in 2nd round of All England
138.article_body: Indian shuttler Kidambi Srikanth lost in second round of men's singles at All England Championships in Birmingham. Fifth-seeded Anthony Sinisuka Ginting beat the World Championships silver-medallist 9-21, 21-18, 21-19. Meanwhile, the Indian duo of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty entered men's doubles quarter-finals after defeating Germany's Mark Lamsfuss and Marvin Seidel 21-7, 21-7.

139.title: Nation celebrating Holi, Shab-e-Barat on same day, this is beauty of India: Naqvi
139.article_body: As the country celebrates Holi and Shab-e-Barat on Friday, Union Minister for Minority Affairs Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said that this is the beauty of our country that the people celebrate all festivals. "This is Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat," Naqvi added. "Holi is the symbol of social unity, communal harmony and brotherhood," Naqvi wrote while sharing pictures on Twitter.

140.title: No player has hit a Test ton faster than Shikhar Dhawan on debut
140.article_body: Batter Shikhar Dhawan smashed the fastest hundred on a Test debut off 85 balls against Australia in the Mohali Test that ended on March 18, 2013. Dhawan overtook West Indies' Dwayne Smith, who slammed Test ton on debut off 93 balls against South Africa in 2004. Dhawan is among the 16 Indians who have hit a century on Test debut.

141.title: 98-yr-old Ukrainian woman who fought World War II offers to fight Russia, govt shares pic
141.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs took to Twitter to share a picture of 98-year-old Olha Tverdokhlibova, who offered to fight for Ukraine against Russia. Olha is a World War II veteran, the ministry stated. "Despite all the merits and experience was denied, though, because of age. We are sure, she will celebrate another victory soon in Kyiv!" it further wrote.

142.title: Norway preparing to host 1 lakh refugees amid conflict in Ukraine: PM
142.article_body: Norwegian PM Jonas Gahr Støre on Friday announced that Norway is preparing to host up to 1 lakh people fleeing the conflict in Ukraine. Norway expects to receive around 30,000 refugees from Ukraine this year, he said. Around 2,000 refugees have arrived in Norway so far and the Norwegian government said that it'll soon receive an additional 5,250 people.

143.title: 1 killed, 4 injured after parts of Russian missile fall on building in Ukraine
143.article_body: One person was killed and four others were injured after parts of a Russian missile fell on a residential building in Ukraine's capital Kyiv on Friday, emergencies services said. Twelve people were rescued and 98 people were evacuated from the five-storey building, the services added. Over 700 people have been killed in Ukraine since Russia's attack, the United Nations said.

144.title: Which are the world's top 10 happiest countries as India in bottom 11?
144.article_body: According to the UN-sponsored World Happiness Report, Finland has been ranked the happiest country in the world, followed by Denmark, Iceland, Switzerland, Netherlands and Luxembourg. Sweden has been ranked seven. Other countries in the top 10 are Norway, Israel and New Zealand. India has been ranked 136 among 146 countries, and Afghanistan has been ranked as the least happiest country.

145.title: Actor Vishal feeds over 200 elderly people on Puneeth's birth anniversary
145.article_body: On late Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar's birth anniversary on Thursday, Vishal served food to more than 200 elderly people across various old age shelters in and around Chennai. The actor, who predominantly works in the Tamil film industry, shared a video on Twitter, writing, "Nothing else would make my friend Puneeth more happy...on his birthday than helping these lovely ones."

146.title: Smeared in colours, CRPF jawans celebrate Holi in Srinagar
146.article_body: The Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel celebrated Holi in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Friday. They smeared colours on each other and danced to Holi songs to celebrate the festival. "We are enjoying the festival. Even if we are away from our family members but the personnel are also part of our family," a jawan said.

147.title: Samoa reports its first unexplained COVID-19 case in community, goes into lockdown
147.article_body: The Pacific island nation of Samoa has sealed its borders as it entered a nationwide lockdown after recording its first unexplained case of COVID-19 in the community. The case was detected in a 29-year-old on the main island of Upolu. A government report leaked online indicated the woman had taken part in church services, and visited places including a hospital.

148.title: Want to shut all 800 restaurants but our Russian partner refused: Burger King owner
148.article_body: Restaurant Brands International, the parent company of Burger King, said it wants to immediately shut all its 800 restaurants in Russia but its Russian joint venture partner has "refused" to do so.  "We can't unilaterally suspend operations" because it's a "complicated legal process", it added. Earlier, the company suspended corporate support for Russian locations amid Ukraine's invasion.

149.title: Britney Spears deletes Instagram account again, fans express concern
149.article_body: Singer Britney Spears' Instagram account was deactivated once again on Wednesday afternoon, following which many of her fans took to social media to express concern. One fan wrote, "Seems like something is going on, we'll see," while another tweeted, "Me right now panicking #BritneySpears." ET Online has reported that the singer is taking "a well-deserved break as many celebrities do".

150.title: Wrestler Sangram Singh announces wedding with Payal Rohatgi in July
150.article_body: Wrestler Sangram Singh on Thursday announced his upcoming wedding with longtime girlfriend actress Payal Rohatgi in July. Sangram tweeted that their wedding was scheduled for March but was postponed amid work commitments. This comes after Payal broke down on reality show 'Lock Upp', saying it has been 12 years since she's been dating Sangram and she wants to get married.

151.title: Fake doctor cheats Pune woman of ₹22 lakh; met her on matrimonial site
151.article_body: A woman in Pune was duped of ₹22 lakh by fraudsters who posed as a doctor on a matrimonial website. She allegedly transferred the amount to them on pretexts like air travel expenditure, gold tax, etc. over a period of eight months. She filed a complaint with the police after realising that the person she met online does not exist.

152.title: Devotees throng at Vrindavan’s Banke Bihari temple to celebrate Holi
152.article_body: With sweets and colours in their hands, devotees gathered in huge numbers at Vrindavan's Banke Bihari temple to celebrate Holi on Friday. They were seen standing in queues to get a glimpse of their deity, Krishna at the temple. They also threw colours on the devotees gathered at the temple. Vrindavan holds a historic significance for the festival of Holi.

153.title: Godzilla actor Akira Takarada dies aged 87
153.article_body: Japanese actor Akira Takarada, known for his role in the original Godzilla, has died at the age of 87. Takarada's death was announced by Toho Studios, the production company responsible for the 1954 movie. In Godzilla, Takarada played Hideto Ogata, a sailor who works with the Japanese Coast Guard after Godzilla sinks a boat.

154.title: ₹2,000 cash found at unicorn founder's home after 3-day I-T raid on Infra.Market
154.article_body: The I-T department conducted a three-day raid at the offices of unicorn startup Infra.Market and the residences of Founders Souvik Sengupta and Aaditya Sharda. It found ₹2,000 in cash and jewellery worth ₹1.2 lakh at Sengupta's residence and cash and jewellery worth ₹20 lakh each at Sharda's residence. No unaccounted cash or assets were found at its offices, Moneycontrol reported.

155.title: About 300 ships carrying grain exports stopped by Russian forces
155.article_body: Russian forces have stopped around 300 ships carrying grain exports from leaving the Black Sea amid the ongoing war in Ukraine. The administrator of the Panamanian Maritime Authority Noriel Arauz said three Panamanian-flagged ships have been struck by Russian fire since the invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. Russia produces nearly 80 million metric tons of wheat per year.

156.title: 'The Kashmir Files' to be screened for Bihar MLAs, MLCs in Patna on Mar 25
156.article_body: The Bihar government is going to arrange a special screening of Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' for MLAs and MLCs of the state. The film will be screened in Patna at 6.30 pm on March 25. "The movie is based on the plight of Kashmiri Pandits...It needs to be watched by more and more people," Deputy CM Tarkishore Prasad said.

157.title: 'Skip Intro' button used 136 mn times a day, saves users’ 195 years: Netflix
157.article_body: In a blog post, Netflix has revealed that its 'Skip Intro' button is pressed about 136 million times each day, saving users across the world a cumulative time of 195 years. Explaining how the ‘Skip Intro’ feature was created five years ago, Netflix stated that 15% of the time customers were manually advancing the series within the first five minutes.

158.title: Japan announces further sanctions on Russian officials, arms exporter
158.article_body: Japan on Friday said it will impose sanctions against 15 Russian individuals and nine organisations including the state-owned arms exporter Rosoboronexport. Since Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Japan's finance ministry said Japan has sanctioned 76 individuals, seven banks and 12 organisations. "These sanctions hit at the heart of Russia's war machine," US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel said.

159.title: Court acquits 2 serving life imprisonment for double murder in Pune
159.article_body: Two men who were serving life imprisonment in connection with the murder of an elderly couple in the Pune district were acquitted by Bombay High Court on Thursday. The couple was murdered in 2009. The court said the trial court was not justified in arriving at the conclusion that the prosecution has proved its case beyond a reasonable doubt.

160.title: UK revokes Russian channel RT's licence amid probe into Ukraine war coverage
160.article_body: UK media regulator has revoked the licence of Russian-backed broadcaster RT amid probe into the impartiality of its coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "We don't consider RT's licensee, ANO TV Novosti, fit and proper to hold...UK broadcast licence," the regulator, Ofcom, said. This move by Ofcom shows that "it's nothing more than a tool of government", RT said.

161.title: India celebrates Holi in Auckland ahead of Australia match in Women's WC
161.article_body: India, who are currently playing in 2022 Women's World Cup, celebrated Holi in Auckland before their next match against Australia on Saturday. BCCI Women posted a picture on Twitter and wrote, "Ringing in the festivities post practice in Auckland. Here's Team India wishing everyone a Happy Holi all the way from New Zealand." India have two wins from four matches.

162.title: Train services between India, Bangladesh likely to resume from March 26
162.article_body: The train services of Maitree Express and Bandhan Express between India and Bangladesh are likely to resume from March 26, said the Ministry of Railways on Thursday. The decision is subjected to the clearance of the Ministry of Home Affairs, the Railways added. The train services between the two countries were suspended in March 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

163.title: NASA rolls out its mega Moon rocket for 1st time, shares pics
163.article_body: NASA has rolled out its mega Moon rocket for the first time. The vehicle, known as the Space Launch System (SLS), along with the Orion capsule atop, was taken to the pad at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida to conduct a dummy countdown. NASA is targeting May as the earliest window for Artemis-1, an uncrewed lunar mission.

164.title: Oil protestor ties himself by neck to goalpost during PL match, pic goes viral
164.article_body: Everton-Newcastle United Premier League match was held up for eight minutes on Thursday after a protestor tied himself to the goalpost at the Gwladys Street end of Goodison Park. The invader was wearing a jersey with the words 'Just Stop Oil'. "[UK] government must end all new fossil fuel supply projects," the group claiming responsibility for the stunt said.

165.title: Robert Pattinson's The Batman crosses $500 million at worldwide box office
165.article_body: Robert Pattinson-starrer 'The Batman' has earned over $500 million at the worldwide box office. The film, which was made on a budget of $200 million, earned over $258.3 million in the US and over $247 million in international markets, as per a report. "We congratulate...the entire cast and crew on this wonderful benchmark," Warner Bros Pictures chairman Toby Emmerich said.

166.title: TV actress among those rescued as prostitution racket busted in Goa
166.article_body: The Goa Crime Branch on Friday said it has arrested a Hyderabad-based man named Hafiz Syed Bilal and rescued three women, including a television actress, after busting a prostitution racket. Two of the rescued women, including the TV actress, are from Virar near Mumbai. "Information was received...and accordingly a trap was laid," the police said.

167.title: Jharkhand's mob lynching bill is not legal: BJP state President
167.article_body: Jharkhand BJP President Deepak Prakash has termed the state's 'Prevention of Mob Violence and Mob Lynching Bill, 2021' as "not legal" and a bill passed by the state assembly for "politics of appeasement". He backed the state Governor Ramesh Bais for returning the draft of the bill and also stated that the bill will "disrupt social harmony" in Jharkhand.

168.title: Narmada project participating states yet to pay ₹7,225 cr to Gujarat: CM
168.article_body: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel said that Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra and Rajasthan, the three participating states of the Sardar Sarovar Narmada Yojana, are yet to give ₹7,225 crore to Gujarat. Madhya Pradesh has to pay ₹4,953.42 crore, Maharashtra ₹1,715.67 crore and Rajasthan ₹556 crore to Gujarat. In the past two years, Madhya Pradesh did not pay anything, Patel added.

169.title: Kim's boyfriend Pete Davidson won't be going to space on Blue Origin flight
169.article_body: American comedian Pete Davidson, who's currently dating socialite Kim Kardashian, will not be flying to space on Blue Origin's upcoming spaceflight, billionaire Jeff Bezos-led space tourism company said as it delayed the launch. The development comes days after Blue Origin announced Davidson would be one of the six passengers on its next spaceflight. It did not provide any further detail.

170.title: Taliban bans broadcast of all foreign TV shows in Afghanistan: Report
170.article_body: The Taliban has banned the broadcast of all foreign TV series in Afghanistan, as per a report. A participant at the meeting of Afghan broadcasters said, "The Taliban clearly said to stop showing any foreign TV series translated into Dari or Pashto [official languages of Afghanistan]." Report added that the authorities said they won't accept any excuses for violating this.

171.title: Diljit Dosanjh to portray singer Amar Singh Chamkila in his biopic: Reports
171.article_body: Actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh has reportedly been roped in to play the role of Amar Singh Chamkila in an upcoming film based on the life of the late musician. The biopic will be directed by filmmaker Imtiaz Ali. Amar and his wife, Amarjot, were killed, along with two members of their band in March 1988 in an assassination which remains unresolved.

172.title: I'd give anything to see you smile 1 more time: Leone on mom's death anniversary
172.article_body: Taking to Instagram on Friday, Sunny Leone penned a note remembering her mother on her death anniversary. Sharing an old picture of herself with her parents, she wrote, "14 years ago today you left us but every day I miss you more...and would give anything to see you smile and call me Googu one more time. Love you Mumma!"

173.title: It's time to break away from societal stereotypes of wedding: Yami
173.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has said it's high time to break away from societal stereotypes for wedding ceremonies. She further said she'd have opted for a minimalist wedding even if it wasn't held during the pandemic. "I would have still worn my mother's sari, my grandmother's nath, dupatta and the aatheru (traditional Kashmiri ear ornament) given by my in-laws," Yami added.

174.title: Rare and deadly virus found in ticks in 6 US states: Study
174.article_body: Scientists have found a rare but potentially deadly Heartland virus in lone star ticks in Georgia. Its RNA has been detected in immature and mature ticks in Missouri, Alabama, Illinois, Kansas and New York so far.
