"Russia is committing war crimes and targeting civilians. Russia's illegal war on Ukraine is a threat to us all," the UK mission said.

349.title: Man teaches helmet's role using watermelon, Hyd Police shares video
349.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Thursday shared a video to spread awareness about the role of helmets. In the video, a man can be seen teaching his son the importance of wearing a helmet while riding a two-wheeler with an example of a watermelon. "Wear a helmet when riding a two-wheeler," the police captioned the video.

350.title: Taxi driver sets himself on fire in UP alleging police harassment
350.article_body: A 26-year-old taxi driver set himself on fire inside the Kotawali Gauriphanta police station campus in Lakhimpur Kheri on Wednesday, alleging he was harassed by the police and four other men. According to the police, the victim alleged that the four men and the police used to extort money from taxi drivers. The victim suffered over 80% burn injuries.

351.title: Car thief who messaged police 'catch me if you can' held in B'luru
351.article_body: A man who allegedly stole over 40 cars across at least nine different states was arrested in Bengaluru. Rajasthan-based Satyendra Singh Shekhawat, who allegedly stole luxury cars and SUVs by using smart gadgets to generate duplicate keys, had challenged police by saying, "catch me if you can." The 41-year-old MBA degree holder was also arrested in 2003.

352.title: We encourage Indian leaders to work closely with us to stand up against Putin: US
352.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Thursday said, "We remain in touch...with leaders in India and continue to encourage leaders to work closely with us to stand up against President Putin's invasion of Ukraine." This comes as US President Joe Biden called Russian President Vladimir Putin a "war criminal" and offered $800 million worth of new weaponry to Ukraine.

353.title: Recognise Putin as war criminal: Ukraine minister to EU lawmakers
353.article_body: Ukrainian Minister Oleksii Reznikov has asked European Union (EU) lawmakers to recognise Russian President Vladimir Putin as a war criminal. Reznikov, in his appeal, mentioned Russian bomb shelling on a theatre in Mariupol on Wednesday, which was sheltering over 1,000 people. Notably, US President Joe Biden has called Putin a war criminal, which Kremlin termed "unforgivable".

354.title: PM Modi speaks to South Korea's President-elect, vows to deepen ties
354.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday spoke to South Korean President-elect Yoon Suk-yeol and congratulated him on his victory in the recently held Presidential elections. PM Modi said, "It was a pleasure to speak with...Yoon Suk-yeol. We discussed the potential of further deepening the India-Korea Special Strategic Partnership in many areas." The South Korean Presidential elections were held on March 9.

355.title: Delhi Police details plan to ensure safe Holi, Shab-e-Barat
355.article_body: Delhi's DCP (Central district) Shweta Chauhan on Thursday said 17 pickets have been placed on roads heading towards New Delhi to ensure intense checking on Holi and Shab-e-Barat. "We've...kept two drones with night vision to keep an eye in the Jama Masjid and Delhi Gate areas," Chauhan said. "Sufficient forces will be deployed. We'll also deploy outside forces," she added.

356.title: Decide on inclusion of Rajbhar community in ST list: HC to UP govt
356.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has asked the Uttar Pradesh government to decide within two months on the inclusion of the Bhar/Rajbhar community in the list of Scheduled Tribes. At present, the community has been given the status of OBC. The court gave the order on a writ petition filed by the Jago Rajbhar Jago Samiti and another on March 11.

357.title: Was truly pampered: Mrunal on working with Ishaan, Priyanshu in Pippa
357.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur, speaking about working with Ishaan Khatter and Priyanshu Painyuli in her upcoming film 'Pippa', has said that working on the film felt like she was around her family. Mrunal added that she was "truly pampered" on the set. "These bonds have surely been formed for life. I hope that reflects on screen," she further said.

358.title: Ukrainian mother of 12 killed on front line of war with Russia
358.article_body: Olga Semidyanova, a 48-year-old combat medic, was killed in battle with Russian Armed Force on the front line of war. Olga had been a military medic since 2014 in the Donetsk region. "Olga Semidyanova was awarded the Mother-Heroine status as a mother of six children and six more adopted," Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs said.

359.title: Man seeks ₹3 cr in bitcoins for Nawab Malik's release, case filed
359.article_body: Maharashtra minister and senior NCP leader Nawab Malik's son Aamir Malik has lodged an FIR with Mumbai Police after a man allegedly demanded ₹3 crore in bitcoins to get his father out on bail. The accused had sent an email to him. "I've lodged the FIR, but can't share more about it as it is a confidential matter," he said.

360.title: Police sends drone to hunt down history-sheeter hiding in pond in Tamil Nadu
360.article_body: The Tenkasi District Police in Tamil Nadu sent a drone to hunt down a history-sheeter who went into hiding in a pond after assaulting the public. The police drone spotted history-sheeter Shahul Hameed hiding in the marshy water. After the drone spotted him, the police surrounded him from all sides and subsequently arrested him.

361.title: He's an absolute legend: Ranveer on father-in-law Prakash Padukone
361.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has said that his father-in-law Prakash Padukone puts on a show when the latter picks up a badminton racquet. "He'll stand in one place and make you run the entire court," Ranveer added. The actor further said that Prakash has got almost saint-like energy. "He's an absolute legend...I...treasure all the life lessons...he teaches us," Ranveer stated.

362.title: PMC to install 11 sewage treatment plants to clean Mula-Mutha River
362.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to increase its sewage treatment facility to treat domestic sewage discharged in the Mula-Mutha River. The civic body plans to install 11 sewage treatment plants to bridge a treatment gap of over 200 MLD. It aims to improve the water quality and ecology by ensuring no untreated sewage water is released into the river.

363.title: NATO starts military drills in Norway amid Russia-Ukraine tensions
363.article_body: NATO has started "massive" military drills in Norway amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Around 30,000 troops, 220 aircraft and 50 vessels from 27 countries are participating in NATO's "Cold Response" 2022 drills. Meanwhile, an official from the Norwegian Joint Headquarters said the military drills were planned months in advance and is in no way linked to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

364.title: Delhi Police appoints 82 legal consultants to improve probe
364.article_body: Delhi Police said that they have hired 82 legal consultants across different districts and in units like the crime branch and special cell to assist investigating officers and to improve the quality of the probe. Officials on Thursday said that the consultants will improve investigation in important cases, help in registering FIRs efficiently and help in training new recruits.

365.title: Honduran judge grants US' extradition request for ex-Prez Hernández
365.article_body: A Honduran judge on Wednesday authorised the extradition of ex-President Juan Orlando Hernández to the US to face drug trafficking and weapons charges. "We're going to file an appeal to try to avoid extradition," Hernández's lawyer said. Hernández, who was arrested last month, has been accused of being involved in a narco-trafficking scheme, accepting bribes and abetting use of weapons.

366.title: Paytm's target price slashed to ₹450 by Macquarie citing 'tough times ahead'
366.article_body: Macquarie has cut its target price for Paytm's parent company One97 Communications Ltd shares by about 36%, to ₹450 apiece, as it sees "tough times ahead" for the company. "With the RBI raising issues with Paytm Payments Bank and Chinese ownership being over 25%, the probability of Paytm getting a small finance banking licence is significantly lower now," Macquarie said.

367.title: Zero COVID-19 patients in Delhi's LNJP Hospital for 1st time in 2yrs
367.article_body: Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan (LNJP) Hospital on Thursday saw zero COVID-19 admissions for the first time since March 2020, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said. LNJP Hospital Medical Director Dr Suresh Kumar said the last two COVID-19 patients were discharged on Wednesday. "Salute to the entire medical fraternity for their dedicated service," Jain added.

368.title: Delhi Police arrest 11 under 'Operation Hifazat' to curb street crime
368.article_body: The South District Police on Tuesday arrested 11 suspects in six different cases under 'Operation Hifazat', which has been launched to curb street crime in Delhi, senior officers said. Deputy Commissioner of Police (south) Benita Mary Jaikar said in six separate operations, two bootleggers, seven gamblers and two criminals carrying illegal knives were arrested.

369.title: 5 of DDA's 6 new sports facilities to be in Dwarka
369.article_body: The Delhi Development Authority (DDA) is developing six sports facilities in Delhi, of which five will be located in Dwarka, including a golf course. The complexes will be located in sectors 17, 8, 19, 23 and 24, where the golf course is proposed. The construction of the ₹45-crore golf course is almost 26% complete, a senior DDA official said.

370.title: Sandeepa posts old home's pic after watching Kashmir Files, says 'family escaped in truck'
370.article_body: After watching 'The Kashmir Files', actress Sandeepa Dhar wrote, "The day they announced Kashmiri Pandits should leave their women behind and leave Kashmir, my family [fled] their homeland, hidden in...truck." She added her family is experiencing PTSD from having to relive it and thanked Vivek Agnihotri for "showing the truth". Sandeepa also shared a picture of their old home.

371.title: BMW modified, fitted with machine gun by Ukrainians to fight Russia; video viral
371.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine war, a video of a modified BMW 6 Series car with a heavy machine gun mounted on it in Ukraine has gone viral on social media. The weapon mounted in the car's trunk is Soviet-era NSV 12.7X108mm, according to reports. The video shows the car painted in the colours of Ukrainian flag.

372.title: Bhupinder Hooda meets Rahul, day after attending rebel leaders' meet
372.article_body: Former Haryana CM and senior Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Thursday met former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi, claimed reports. A day earlier, Hooda had attended the meeting of rebel leaders of Congress, to discuss the party's situation after the poor performance in polls. Reportedly, Hooda visited senior party leader Ghulam Nabi Azad after meeting Gandhi.

373.title: Many people in Russia are showing themselves to be traitors: Kremlin
373.article_body: Many people in Russia were showing themselves to be "traitors", Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Thursday, pointing at those "leaving their jobs" and "moving to other countries". His comments came a day after Russian President Vladimir Putin said Russia is undergoing a "natural and necessary self-cleansing" as people were able to "distinguish the true patriots from the scum and...traitors".

374.title: Thanks Shahid for making these 6 months fun: Ali post wrapping shoot
374.article_body: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar has said that the shooting of his upcoming film, which features actor Shahid Kapoor, has been completed. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Thank you, Shahid, and the entire team for making these last six months super fun." The untitled film is reportedly an adaptation of a French action thriller, 'Nuit Blanche'.

375.title: Taiwan to launch locally made satellites in 2026: Minister
375.article_body: Taiwanese Science and Technology Minister Wu Tsung-tsong has said the country could launch locally made satellites from its territory in 2026, a report stated. Tsung-tsong said he hoped the construction of the satellite's base could start in 2024 and by 2025, it would be completed, the report added. The ministry is reportedly looking for a site for the satellites' launch.

376.title: Meta to allow parents to track their kids' Instagram time globally
376.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta will allow parents to track how much time their children are spending on Instagram globally soon. The Instagram supervision tools will roll out globally over the coming months, Meta said. Parents will also be able to see what accounts their children follow and set time limits for their kids to spend on the app.

377.title: Remove real culprit or Cong will be haunted in 2024 and beyond: Sunil Jakhar
377.article_body: Days after Congress chief Sonia Gandhi sacked party chiefs of five states including Punjab, senior leader Sunil Jakhar said, "A sham 'witch-hunt' will not help. Show courage. Censure and remove the real culprit from high positions." "Otherwise, this ghost of religion/caste/identity politics will haunt the Congress party in Punjab even in 2024 and beyond," he added.

378.title: India's 1st vaccine to protect lions against CDV in clinical trial stage
378.article_body: The clinical trials for India's first indigenously-produced vaccine against Canine Distemper Virus (CDV) have begun. The vaccine, developed by Gujarat Biotechnology and Research Centre (GBRC), has shown over 80% efficacy according to initial results, a state government official said. The virus is reported to have killed 30 lions at Gir National Park in Gujarat in 2018.

379.title: India managed Omicron surge much better than other countries: Centre
379.article_body: India's COVID-19 vaccination drive helped the nation to manage Omicron surge better than other countries, Lav Agarwal, Joint Secretary, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said. "Today...15-17 lakh cases are being reported globally but India is reporting around 3000 daily cases," he said. India has administered over 180 crore vaccine doses which is 3.2 times more than US, he added.

380.title: 2 men from Bihar arrested in Mumbai for possessing charas worth ₹1 cr
380.article_body: Two men from Bihar were arrested in Mumbai for possessing 3 kg of charas worth ₹1 crore. The accused were arrested on Tuesday in Goregaon (east) when they had arrived to deliver the contraband, an official said. "During the probe, it was found that the accused were involved in supplying contraband in different parts of...country," zonal DCP Somnath Gharge said.

381.title: Govt orders aggressive genome sequencing as COVID cases rise in Asia, Europe: Report
381.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has directed officials to aggressively carry out genomic sequencing as COVID-19 cases are rising again in some Asian and European countries, reports said. The two-hour-long meeting was attended by the head of India's COVID-19 task force Dr VK Paul, AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria and ICMR chief Dr Balram Bhargava among other people, reports added.

382.title: Crypto produces 17 'known' billionaires worldwide: Hurun Rich List 2022
382.article_body: Cryptocurrency has produced 17 "known" billionaires worldwide, according to the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List. The pack of 17 billionaires is led by Changpeng Zhao, the CEO of the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, Binance. He's followed by Bahamian cryptocurrency exchange FTX's CEO Sam Bankman-Fried. Brian Armstrong, the CEO of Coinbase, is the world's third-richest crypto billionaire.

383.title: Vaccination drive a testament to India's capabilities: Mansukh Mandaviya
383.article_body: Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya said India's vaccination drive that produced affordable vaccines for Indians and exported them to over 150 countries is a testament to India's capabilities. He also thanked health workers, NGOs for working tirelessly throughout the pandemic. "Management of COVID-19 pandemic...has strongly demonstrated to the world the power of...self-reliance," he added.

384.title: Guj govt schools to teach English from Class 1 instead of Class 3
384.article_body: Gujarat government schools will now teach English as a subject from Class 1 instead of Class 3 from the new academic session starting June 2022, state Education Minister Jitu Vaghani announced on Thursday. "Gujarati is mandatory and important but English will be taught to Class 1 and 2 students too," he said. The minister was speaking in the state Assembly.

385.title: Do you support this bloody war, SAP: Ukraine Vice PM on video of Russian attack
385.article_body: Ukraine's Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov tweeted a video showing the destruction in the country amid Russia's attack and wrote, "Do you support this, SAP? Or you can stop your support?" Fedorov alleged, "After 21 days of bloody war, German company SAP continues technically supporting its Russian clients - Gazprom, Sberbank, Rosatom and others." "This money murders Ukrainian children!" he added.

386.title: My son is happy that I'm working: Sonali on judging 'Dance India Dance...'
386.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre, who is currently judging the reality show 'Dance India Dance Li'l Masters' season 5, years after being diagnosed with cancer, spoke about her son's reaction to her working after long. She said, "He's very happy that his mother is working and is out of his hair now. He'd be saying that 'it's good that mom is busy'."

387.title: I'm really excited: Viay on working with Kareena in Sujoy Ghosh's next
387.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma, who recently announced a new project with Sujoy Ghosh, said he's really excited to share screen space with actors Kareena Kapoor Khan and Jaideep Ahlawat. He added, "I had been waiting to tell the world about it." "Not only is the script so amazing but also the kind of team [I'm getting] to work with," Vijay said.

388.title: Instagram bans Kanye for 24 hrs over racial post against Trevor Noah
388.article_body: Instagram has banned US rapper Kanye West for 24 hours for violating its policies on hate speech, bullying and harassment. Kanye had directed a racial post at talk show host Trevor Noah after he said Kanye was harassing his former wife Kim Kardashian. The rapper responded by replacing some of 'Kumbaya' song lyrics with a racial slur against Black people.

389.title: Over 19 lakh people have entered Poland from Ukraine since war began
389.article_body: More than 19,50,000 people have entered Poland from Ukraine since Russia invaded the country on February 24, Chancellery of the PM of Poland said on Thursday. Around 60,000 people had entered the country from Ukraine on Wednesday alone, it added. According to the UN refugee agency, more than 30 lakh people have now fled Ukraine to escape the war.

390.title: Reform, perform, transform to next level: PM to trainee civil servants
390.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday addressed the valedictory function of the 96th Common Foundation Course at Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy of Administration, Mussoorie. Speaking to the IAS trainees, he urged them to focus on the "biggest goal of the 21st century" Atmanirbhar Bharat and Modern India. He further asked them to "reform, perform and transform to the next level".

391.title: I wish to be a suicide bomber to blow up opposition: Pakistan minister
391.article_body: As Pakistan PM Imran Khan faces no-confidence motion, Pakistan Minister Ghulam Sarwar Khan said, "Although suicide bombing is forbidden, I wish to be a suicide bomber to blow up the entire opposition." Voting on the no-confidence motion is slated to take place between March 26 and 30, with Imran Khan saying the opposition's motion is going to fail.

392.title: Majority of people say they thought I would be like a sexbot: Bella Hadid
392.article_body: American model Bella Hadid said, "The majority of the time when I meet people, they say, 'I...didn't think you...[would] be nice, that you were going to be...some kind of a sexbot." "For three years while I was working, I would wake up...hysterical, in tears alone," added Bella. "I was on this calorie-counting app which was like the devil," stated Bella.

393.title: Pankaj denies doing Pawan Kalyan's film, says 'Hope to work with him soon'
393.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi dismissed the reports that he will be a part of Pawan Kalyan's film 'Bhavadeeyudu Bhagat Singh'. He said, "Reading the news of doing a film with Pawan Kalyan on social media made me really happy...But as much as I want this news to be true, unfortunately, it's not. But I...hope I get to work with him someday."

394.title: Speechless, moved to tears: Zoe Saldana on watching 20 minutes of 'Avatar 2'
394.article_body: Sharing her experience on watching 20 minutes of 'Avatar 2' which is the sequel to 2009 film 'Avatar', actress Zoe Saldana who starred in the original film said, "I was speechless. I was moved to tears." "I can get choked up just talking about it," added Saldana. 'Avatar' is among the highest-grossing movies of all time.

395.title: RR have got the 2 best spinners in IPL in Ashwin, Chahal: Sangakkara
395.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara said the franchise have got the two best spinners in the IPL in Ravichandran Ashwin and Yuzvendra Chahal. "We have secured depth in every department," added Sangakkara. Ashwin has taken 145 wickets in 167 IPL matches with Chahal picking 139 wickets in 114 matches.

396.title: BJP leader Pravin Darekar granted protection from arrest till Mar 21
396.article_body: BJP leader and Maharashtra Legislative Council Leader of Opposition Pravin Darekar has been granted protection from arrest by a Mumbai court till March 21. Darekar's anticipatory bail plea will be heard on March 21. He had filed the bail application regarding an FIR registered against him for fraudulently contesting a cooperative bank election in the 'labour' category.

397.title: Robot-assisted surgery in Delhi helps man shed diapers after 24 yrs
397.article_body: A 24-year-old Yemenese man suffering from a congenital defect called Extropy Epispadias Complex was operated in a robot-assisted surgery in Delhi which has enabled him to shed diapers he was using for 24 years. In this condition, the lower abdominal wall does not develop at all, leaving the bladder open with urine draining out from the open abdomen, doctors said.

398.title: Twitter account of Statistics Ministry briefly hacked, name changed to Elon Musk
398.article_body: The official Twitter handle of the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation briefly appeared to be hacked on Thursday. Hackers changed the account's display name to Elon Musk and display photo to that of the Tesla CEO and posted several tweets on Musk's timeline. This comes months after Information and Broadcasting Ministry's Twitter account was hacked.

399.title: Taiwan inseparable part of China, don’t equate it with Ukraine: Chinese envoy
399.article_body: Chinese ambassador to the United States Qin Gang called against equating Taiwan with Ukraine, saying that while the latter is a sovereign state, the former is an inseparable part of China's territory. "We hope the United States earnestly abides by the one-China principle and does not support 'Taiwan independence' separatism in any form," he added.

400.title: Kejriwal gives govt job to brother of IB staffer killed in Delhi riots
400.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday gave an appointment letter for a government job to Ankur Sharma, the brother of Intelligence Bureau staffer Ankit Sharma who was killed in the 2020 Delhi riots. Ankur has been posted in the Education Department of the Delhi Government. "We can't compensate for...loss of a loved one...[but] this...job...will be of immense help," Kejriwal tweeted.

401.title: Sceptics wondering ‘Even that's possible': 'Gangubai...' producer on its success
401.article_body: Jayantilal Gada, who is one of the producers of Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' said, "People didn't expect much from the film. Now that the [film's]...successful, the sceptics are...wondering, 'Ok, even that's possible'." Gada is also one of the producers of the upcoming film 'RRR', which stars Ram Charan, Jr NTR. "The film will generate...greater...craze than 'Baahubali'," added Gada.
